intro: Palicourea guianensis var. tetramera, commonly known as the Guianan palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four stamens. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in humid, shaded forest environments. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
